vehiclesimulationcore
Class VehicleGeom

java.lang.Object
  vehiclesimulationcore.VehicleGeom
public class VehicleGeom
extends java.lang.Object

Title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Program

Description: vehicle dynmaics, braking system simulation

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2006 Faculty of Information Technology Engineering at Damascus University

VehicleGeom constsis of two classes: BodyGeom and WheelGeom
this class holds information and data of the vehicle geometry and responsible
for all transformations application on it through applying appropriate behaviors
separation of the vehicle model into two component classes is better for organizational issue so the VehicleGeom wont be a miss with so many feilds and members

the vehicle has one TransformGroup for it's body ( and thus a it's own coordinate system you can say) and a TransformGroup for each wheel( and thus a separate coordinate sytem for each wheel) wheels are relative to the body, the body is relative to world coordinates

we assign a behaviour with the vehicle to enable crusiing using the keyboard

Constructor Summary
VehicleGeom(BodyGeom bodyGeom, WheelGeom LF, WheelGeom LB, WheelGeom RF, WheelGeom RB)
          passing a Body geometry object and a geomerty object for each wheel we ensemble the vehicle, we also create the behaviour body and wheel are loaded the Loader class and well ensembled using the VehicleCoords class
 
Method Summary
 void bindCamera(boolean bind)
          bind the camera to this vehicle, and update it's poition-look at and up vectors the default camera view is TVPos1: behind and looking at the vehicle
(package private)  void gatherParts()
          gather partial geometries into one parant transform group to make the vehicle
 void reset()
          reset the vehicle position and angle to 0s
 void rotateFrontWheels(double angle)
          just rotate the front wheels with the same angle arround thier vertical axis so just call the wheel's functions
 void rotateVehicle(javax.vecmath.Vector3d angles)
          issue a rotate command rotate in absolute, assuming the at init position the vehicle was at 0,0,0 and looking towards the negative X axis we pass a vector of 3 values representing the rotation angles arround x-y-z using this method we rotate the vehicle starting from the original rotation angle we only change this component the way we do this is: for each angle we got a rotation matrix 3 X 3 matrix which is set to the rotation matrix arround it's axis, then we multiply these three matixes into one final which holds the required effect we could provide another method for relative rotation staring by current angles
(package private)  void setBodyGeom(BodyGeom geom)
          if you want to switch parts
 void setCoords(javax.vecmath.Vector3d pos, javax.vecmath.Vector3d ang)
          merge all changes in one transform and apply it once instead of applying in many we set the transform to the poition and rotation matrix then apply it to the vehicle

          update the vehicle position, also the binded camera

rotateFrontWheels

Parameters:
angle - double

rotateVehicle

public void rotateVehicle(javax.vecmath.Vector3d angles)
issue a rotate command rotate in absolute, assuming the at init position the vehicle was at 0,0,0 and looking towards the negative X axis we pass a vector of 3 values representing the rotation angles arround x-y-z using this method we rotate the vehicle starting from the original rotation angle we only change this component

the way we do this is: for each angle we got a rotation matrix 3 X 3 matrix which is set to the rotation matrix arround it's axis, then we multiply these three matixes into one final which holds the required effect

we could provide another method for relative rotation staring by current angles

setCoords

public void setCoords(javax.vecmath.Vector3d pos,
                      javax.vecmath.Vector3d ang)
merge all changes in one transform and apply it once instead of applying in many we set the transform to the poition and rotation matrix then apply it to the vehicle

ang - double
